title: CASH IN THE ATTIC: Comic 2000AD has been around for forty years - and this issue can sell for £500
text:
This comic complete with a ‘Biotronic Man’ transfer free gift, can sell for £500

Every week we give the low-down on the value of forgotten treasures that may be gathering dust at home.

Judge Dredd has been enforcing the law in comic 2000AD for four decades – and early artwork of his exploits has proved a shrewd investment.

The front cover of the Judge Dredd ‘King of the Streets!’ illustration for issue ‘Prog 204’ of the comic drawn in 1981 by Mike McMahon sold for £9,600 last month – double the auction price estimate.

Dredd has protected 22nd Century Mega City One in his own cartoon strip since the second issue of 2000AD in March 1977.

This comic, pictured above, complete with a ‘Biotronic Man’ transfer free gift, can sell for £500. The comic originally cost ‘8 pence Earth money’.

The earliest published Dredd artwork was penned by McMahon and a page that appeared in ‘Prog 6’ with Dredd on his bike is valued at £15,000.
description: Judge Dredd has been enforcing the law in comic 2000AD for four decades - and early artwork of his exploits has proved a shrewd investment.
authors: Towalne For The Mail On Sunday
